abstract.para: The behavior of the systemd-journald service can be adjusted by modifying /etc/systemd/journald.conf. Note that you need to restart the journal for the changes to take effect with

section.title: Changing the journal size limit
section.para: The journal log data uses up to 10% of the file system the /var/log/journal resides on. For example, if /var/log/journal is located on a 30 GB /var partition, the journal may use up to 3 GB of the disk space. To change this limit, change (and uncomment) the SystemMaxUse option:
